ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup butter, 1/4 cup powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup chopped nuts
author: CookieMonster
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C)...
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together butter and powdered sugar until light and fluffy...
3. Add vanilla extract and salt, mix well...
4. Gradually add flour and chopped nuts, and mix until the dough comes together...
5. Shape the dough into small cookies...
6. Place them on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes or until they are lightly golden...
7. Let them cool before serving...

ingredients: 1 cup chocolate chips, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt
author: BrownieLover
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C)...
2. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate chips and butter together in 30-second intervals, stirring until smooth...
3. Stir in sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract...
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, and salt...
5. Add the dry ingredients to the chocolate mixture and mix until combined...
6. Pour the batter into a greased baking pan...
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out with a few moist crumbs...
8. Allow to cool before cutting into squares...

ingredients: 2 cups strawberries, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 cup heavy cream
author: SummerTreats
instructions:
1. Hull and slice strawberries, then toss with sugar and lemon juice in a bowl...
2. Whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form...
3. Slice shortcake or biscuits in half...
4. Spoon strawberries onto the bottom half of each shortcake...
5. Top with whipped cream and the other half of the shortcake...
6. Serve immediately...

ingredients: 1 cup flour, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 cup chocolate chips
author: CookieLover
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)...
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth...
3. Beat in the egg until well blended...
4. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt...
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture...
6. Stir in the chocolate chips...
7. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet...
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are golden...
9. Allow to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack...

ingredients: 2 cups milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cornstarch, 1/4 cup cocoa powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 2 eggs, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
author: PuddingMaster
instructions:
1. In a saucepan, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, cocoa powder, and salt...
2. Gradually add milk and whisk until smooth...
3. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens...
4. In a separate bowl, beat eggs...
5. Gradually add a small amount of the hot mixture to the eggs, whisking constantly to temper the eggs...
6. Pour the egg mixture back into the saucepan and cook for 2 minutes...
7. Remove from heat, stir in butter and vanilla extract...
8. Pour into serving dishes and chill in the refrigerator until set...
